cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSW of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Cayman Islands and western Cuba, then moving through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern U.S. Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches/warnings limited to the Cayman Islands and western Cuba at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cayman Islands and the Cuban provinces of Matanzas, Mayabeque, Havana, Artemisa, Pinar del Rio, and Isle of Youth under Tropical-Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern U.S. Gulf Coast from central Texas to the Alabama/Florida state line (including Mississippi and Louisiana coasts)
weather_observation.wind: 30% chance of 34-kt (tropical-storm) winds and 6% chance of 50-kt winds Sunday–Monday; strongest winds most likely Sunday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal water rise of 2–4+ ft possible in Mobile Bay if the center makes landfall west of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts beginning late Sunday and continuing Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, rough seas and dangerous rip-currents ahead of landfall
